detaileddescription.para: The NicknameParser interprets a 2-column CSV as though it contains WWPN, Alias For example:

Additionally, this parser can be used to pull data from any CSV; for example, if your CSV has more than just WWPN/Nickname (which is typical when pulled from another resource), you might have:BusinessUnit, Server, WWPN, CapEx Code, Location Billing, BillingBigBox, c050761122334455, 2013A4, Houston CustServ, Service44, 1000001b32123456, 2013A4, Dallas
You can use system-wide parameters or file-specific parameters to set a different column number (see the jvmopt "wwn", "nickname")
This collector/parser chain is slightly more successful than text-based parsers due to proper interpretation of MS-DOS "I'm the exception" line-ending markers.
